class.name: Word.Source
class.description: Represents an individual source, such as a book, journal article, or interview.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: isCited
properties.description: Gets if the Source object has been cited in the document.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: Gets the tag of the source.

properties.name: xml
properties.description: Gets the XML representation of the source.

methods.name: getFieldByName
methods.description: Returns the value of a field in the bibliography Source object.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Source object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.SourceData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

returns.description: a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.SourceData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with t
